reviews.text: Our family has stayed here every summer for several years and always had a great time. The location is excellent. It is right on the beach in a very upscale neighborhood away from a lot of the noise and congestion that you often find at other places in the center of town. Just a short ride to the boardwalk and there is a trolley that stops right out front for $2 a person if you don't want to be bothered with driving or looking for parking when you're ready to go to the boardwalk. Two room types are available. Oceanfront motels rooms sleep either 2 in a king or 4 in two queens. Both have private balconies overlooking the pool, which is very nice, along with direct ocean front views. For families, there are ocean view rooms on the north and south side of the building which are two room efficiency units with complete kitchens. There is a queen sized sleeper sofa in the living room with either a king or a queen and a twin in the bedroom. No private balcony in these rooms but there are chairs outside on a common walkway for very nice views of the beach and ocean. Jamaica Me Hungry is the restaurant on the premises and serves a very good breakfast with many interesting choices including a lobster and asparagus benedict and banana pancakes. They have a convenient take out window which is great for packing lunches for the beach. Their fruit salad is large and delicious, a perfect lunch item. Ice Cream for the kids, too, burgers, hot dogs and a better than average lunch menu. The grilled chicken quesadilla and cuban sandwich were both outstanding. At nite, they serve seafood, chicken and ribs and some very good desserts. Everything here was truly outstanding and they accept credit cards too. This place has everything you need. Clean, quiet and comfortable. Can't say enough, this is our place for years to come!
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, great location, spectacular beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stood at a hotel in Wildwood for 28 years before taking my business to the Regal Plaza this past August. Had no problems with room and will think strongly about returning in 2013.
reviews.title: Decent place, may come back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cable was lousy with no sports channels at all and the one lady at the desk (not the older one, she was super nice) had better things to do then answer my question. In other words, she was ignorant.
reviews.title: Comfortable, beautiful view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But that does not make or break a stay and I am considering a return.
reviews.title: Hotel and desk, very nice

reviews.text: We have been going to Wildwood Crest for many years. Decided to try the Regal Plaza. We have friends who stay here every summer and pay half the price that we pay at a hotel two buildings away. We stayed in a King size oceanfront room. It was nice; however, could use some minor fix ups. The carpet was a little torn, vents needed to be cleaned, counter end caps were chipped in places and the towels are very thin and non absorbent. That being said, the bed was very comfortable and the front desk staff were friendly. When we go down n the summer, we will stay in one of the efficiencies. We did peek in several of the vacant rooms and they look very nice. I think we will give this place a try next summer. Hotel is within walking distance of local restaurant Crest Tavern, our favorite place. We were there for the Irish Festival that was going on in North Wildwood. Trolley shuttles were running back and forth. There are a lot of "don't do's". I thought it was comical that the contents of each room is listed ... Along with fines for missing items. Televisions need to be updated and add a DVD player. Ask comical that there were still VHS players ... Who has those anymore. Rentals were 3 dollars a night, which I thought was very high.
reviews.title: Clean, But...

reviews.text: Stayed July 6 to 10. We have been comming here for over 20 years. GREAT price, Very clean, Right on Beach, Nice heated pool. Best place for famlies. See you next year
reviews.title: Always Good

reviews.text: We are looking forward to our third vacation in the Crest at the Regal Plaza. After staying at another not-as-nice, but more expensive, hotel on our first visit to the shore, we were lucky to find the Regal on our second, and have stayed there since. While it isn't fancy or plush, it is clean and well kept, very reasonably priced, and located very nicely if you don't want to be right on the Boardwalk. It is very convenient to the Cape May bridge, and we enjoy this quieter end of town. The 2-room efficiency is a great value and has plenty of room for our family of 4. The on-site restaurant has excellent food and a friendly staff. The beach is great. Only complaint I have is that the "heated" pool is not very heated.... And the check-in time is very late, but they will let you in if your room is vacated and ready for you.
reviews.title: Great family place to stay!
Good Value and Clean!
reviews.text: We have stayed here twice for 10 days. The location is great. The rooms are nothing extravagant, but they are clean- we had the 2 room efficiency and had ample room for ourselves and teenage daughter. The bathroom is small but again is clean. Wooden walkway for beach access so you don't have to lug stuff through the sand. Jamaica Me Hungry Restaurant is very good.

reviews.title: Nice hotel
reviews.text: We have stayed at the regal plaza for many years. The rooms are not plush but are clean and functional. We always rent the suites with a fridge, stove, and microwave. A/C works great. The pool is very nice and well maintained. Nice walkway to the beach is available. The elevator can be kind of slow when people are checking in and out but that's kind of picking nits. Our shower head was not working right when we checked in and the maintennance guy fixed it within an hour of our call. It's an aging hotel but is still kept very well. I guess people used to more modern hotels will find it lacking in some areas but the rooms are still nice. I would love to see them get internet access in the rooms but hey, it's a vacation hotel.

reviews.title: Regal Plaza, Always a nice place to stay
reviews.text: I have been going to WildWood for over 27 years,sometimes twice a year. Our first choice is always the Regal Plaza. Unfortunetly many times it's hard for us to plan in advance and on last minute trips it has been booked, but we always try to go back there because we have never had a bad room, nor a bad vacation there.

Stayed here recently with my family. Great location at the southern end of Wildwood Crest. Quiet beach area compared to busy Wildwood. Rooms were very clean and reasonably priced. Amazing front desk staff (Danielle). Helped with every detail of check in through departure. Great restaurant suggestions, and even pointed out small unique aspects that only the Wildwoods have (charming fruit trucks selling produce right at your hotel!). Will return as soon as possible......
reviews.title: Excellent!!

reviews.text: We stayed at this resort Friday night we had reservations for Friday & Saturday but could not
reviews.title: Very dissatisfied!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stay the two nights due to no air conditioning, no fan in bathroom in running condition very
reviews.title: This motel had it all... in 1985

reviews.text: dirty unit, and when we complained the desk was very arrogant and rude. We couldn't get any refund, we had their brochure which is very deceiving and they don't tell you cannot cancel
reviews.title: I couldn't be happier

reviews.text: even in advance and get 75% of your deposit returned llike most hotels in Wildwood, they
reviews.title: A Great place to stay, friendly and clean

reviews.text: We have been coming to Regal Plaza for many years, always the week after 4th of July and we see the same people every year. That must say something about a place that gets the same people every year. The rooms are very large and most important Very Clean. In fact we see the same cleaning staff every year. We come in a large group and usually get the whole floor. It's like one long terrace. We are all together. Right on the beach and this year they built a newer, wider and longer walking path. We stay on the beach and then all meet at the pool. The pool is big, heated and great for younger kids. Jamaica Me Hungry is back with great food and hotel guests get coupons . Like everyone else we will be back next year.
reviews.title: Very Clean---Great Price

reviews.text: We stayed there a few weeks ago and have many times before this. Our room was very clean, cool, with a great view of the beach, pool and ocean. The staff is excellent and the Jamaica Me Hungry Restaurant downstairs had great food & we were delighted to get free dining cards for it. We think the best thing about staying there is the beach it is on is spectacular. One thing we wish they would improve on is a nicer TV & add microwaves to the non efficiency rooms so you can warm up leftovers from restaurants.
reviews.title: Great Shore Hotel

reviews.text: Last minute arrangements to a large two room efficiency unit complete with kitchen and dinning area. Location is deep in the Crest right on the beach. Walking distance to some restaurants but a short drive to the boardwalk. The vouchers received at check-in for the coffee shop/restaurant on the premises was a welcome surprise and helped out with breakfast everyday of our stay - but get there early because the restaurant is small and you may have to wait. The room was typical of a beach front property - nothing fancy - clean and perfect if you spend more time at the pool or beach instead of your room. The two older model TV's didn't get much use as we logged most of our time at the beach. The bedroom had a twin and a queen - the living had a pull-out queen sofa. Daily maid service made the impromptu arrangements convenient as we traveled light. Overall - good value - nothing fancy.
reviews.title: Good value - basic shore hotel

reviews.text: After staying at another hotel for many years we switched to Regal Plaza because of the cost. Other place cost us almost 1700 for a week, Regal Plaza cost us half that. Last September we stayed in an oceanfront king room. This trip we stayed in one of the ocean view efficiency suites. The room was roomy for three. Son said the sofa bed was not very comfortable. Our king bed was comfortable. We brought our own pillows. Their pillows not so comfortable. Very limited cable selection but who is really watching that much tv at the beach. Wi-Fi was newly added and service was spotty. We had a coffee maker, iron, ironing board, full size frig. Check to be sure you have a coffee maker before you go. Friends of ours stayed in the same type of room but had a percolator. There are no hair dryers provided. Hotel is in a quiet area away from the boardwalk. Love the location. Bonus is the restaurant at the hotel, Jamaica Me Hungry. Fantastic food. Even if I was staying elsewhere I would stop here for breakfast. Staff was friendly. Two washers and dryers on 2nd floor.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Great Location

reviews.text: I first stayed here in 2011 with my parents for the weekend, after that I went back again in June 2012 and ill be heading back this June. Love the location, sundecks and pool, and the clean rooms! Theyre very nice in the office as well as the resturaunt downstairs. Such a peaceful and fun place to stay.
reviews.title: Great for short and long stays.

reviews.text: we have gone to this place for 3 years now and are planning on going again june 13 this year of 2011, honestly cant wait , out of all 3 stays we had we have never had any disapointments, the furniture was pretty comfortable and it was kept pretty clean the pool was clean and has a great ocean front view, the air conditioning has always worked well and we have always have fun, i liked to sit out on the lounge chairs at night to relax and listen to the crashing of the waves on the beach, every year we stayed in a two room eficency, everything worked and we had no problems what so ever, guess some people got unlucky and things didnt go as planned because of some minor technical diffaculties but overall this is a great place to stay :)
reviews.title: Pretty good motel

reviews.text: Oceanfront. They have a queen size pull out couch in living room and a queen size bed, plus a single bed in a separate bedroom. It is also an efficiency. It is not luxurious, but neither are most of the older hotels in Wildwood Crest and it is clean enough. The pool is a reasonable size with plenty of lounge chairs, but no diving board or slide anymore. The owner is not particularly kind but you don't see him much and the front desk woman is nice. The breakfast and lunch take out menu from their restaurant is good. Two negatives for this year were that the cable television channels have been reduced drastically. Not good for a boring night or a bad weather day. The other is that pipes have been extended into the ocean throughout the beach and sadly two sets are fairly close to this hotel. So, we looked at the prices of other motels and found this one still offers us the most for our money so will be going back again for probably our 20th visit.
reviews.title: Good Value for Family of 5

reviews.text: My six year old son and I were walking down the roads site seeing and my son needed to go potty really bad, number 2. Well I asked the front desk and they said they don't have a bathroom. I said it was an emergency and this is a hotel...come on! The lady yells at me and my son "what do you want me to do...we don't have a bathroom for you. Get out!" How heartless can someone be?!?! I will never recommend anyone I know to go there now.
reviews.title: mangement and the people at the front desk are so rude!

reviews.text: My family travelled to Wildwood Crest last September. We stayed at the Regal Plaza. As we arrived in Wildwood so did a major tropical storm! Wildwood was flooded, it rained for 7 days and was so windy that it was hard to breathe outside the motel room. We brought our 2 sons, 3yrs. and 9 months. Imagine being stuck in a motel for 7 days with 2 small active boys! The room we stayed in was great! Clean, and well kept. Our microwave stopped working one day and the management immediately repaired it for us! They even offered us the use of another room while they were working on it (it only took a second to repair!). They management kept giving us free childrens movies to keep our kids occupied during the STORM week! As we were getting ready to check out the staff told us it was going to clear up the next day and offered us a free nights stay becuase we really had no outside time at the beach!! We love the accomodation, cleanliness and helpfullness of the Regal Plaza. We will be back in the summer!
reviews.title: Great Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i was petrified after i booked my stay here and read some of these reviews...but this place wasn't nearly as bad as these reviews make it out to be. first of all, for the price, the value is great. we paid about 115 bucks a night for an ocean front (not ocean view) room with a nice balcony. the place is literally on the beach, location couldn't be much better. it's a quiet place. room was decent. the only complaint we had was some noise coming from the air conditioning, but it wasn't bad. they have a decent restaurant with good breakfast. you can't come here and expect the ritz carlton, but for 115 bucks a night on labor day weekend in the WWC/Cape May Area, you aren't going to do much better. the other hotels in the area looked awful. we were surprisingly pleased...just keep your expectations reasonable.
reviews.title: you get what you pay for
nice location but checkout too early
reviews.text: Nice location near the southern end of the Crest. Rooms are average size. Room had a small refrigerator but no microwave. Room was smelly from cigarette smoke. Lighting was okay with only two 3-way lamps. Air conditioning worked well. Bathroom was in nice condition. Elevator was very slow so I often had to use the steps. Stairways were not very clean with same debris seen in the several days I was there. Pool was nice size and heated in the later hours of operation. There was good beach access with wooden steps and walkway. Checkout time was too early with a 10 AM checkout time that is not family-friendly.

reviews.title: Clean, Good location
reviews.text: Stayed at the Regal Plaza on Wilwood Crest for three nights with our
